title: Inkbrush Nouveau
paragraphs: The Inkbrush Nouveau is a main weapon in the Splatoon series. It is the Nouveau-branded version of the Inkbrush.

The Inkbrush Nouveau is nearly identical in appearance to the Inkbrush. The only difference between the two is that the Inkbrush Nouveau has a sticker bearing the Nouveau logo on the metal part. In Splatoon 3, the Inkbrush Nouveau has a slightly updated appearance, now having lighter-toned bristles and a brass ferrule.

The Inkbrush Nouveau was released on 1 August 2015 at 02:00 UTC.[1][2] The Inkbrush Nouveau is a variation of the Inkbrush, maintaining the same stats, but instead comes with Ink Mines and the Bubbler.
- Promotional image
- An Inkling running with the Inkbrush Nouveau
- An Inkling swiping the Inkbrush Nouveau
- Official art of an Inkling holding the Inkbrush Nouveau
- SplatNet icon
The Inkbrush Nouveau was released on 11 November 2017 at 02:00 UTC.[4] It comes with Ink Mines and the Baller.

The Inkbrush Nouveau returns in Splatoon 3. Its design is similar to the Inkbrush, but its bristles are lighter, the and the metal part on the paint tube is now brass instead of silver. Its kit contains Ink Mines and the Ultra Stamp. It debuted in Chill Season 2022.

For competitive tips about the Inkbrush Nouveau
- The ink reservoir below the brush's head seems to made from an oil paint tube, fitting in with the brush theme.
- The Inkbrush Nouveau was first revealed in a tweet from Nintendo of Europe.
- Across all three games, the Inkbrush Nouveau has received Ink Mine as its sub weapon.

Inkbrush Nouveau is a combination of Ink and Brush, as well as Nouveau, french for New. Nouveau may also refer to Art Nouveau. The suffix Nouveau is also used to differentiate it from the Inkbrush. This trait is shared among the other alternate sets of the Nouveau brand.

パブロ・ヒュー Paburo hyū is a reference to Pablo Picasso, a famous Spanish Cubist artist. ヒュー hyū refers to [[WP:Hue|hue]. Like Nouveau in the English name, Hue is used to differentiate it from the Inkbrush.
